translated: Verses of the Elder Nuns .
The Group of Sixes

analyzed: sujātā atherī gāthā  alaṅkatā su vasanā
translated: The Elder Nun Sujātā🔽Adorned and well-dressed,
wearing garlands and sandalwood,
covered in all my jewelry,
with a retinue of female slaves.
Taking food and drink,
and much to chew and consume,
I left the house
and went to the pleasure park.
Having enjoyed and played there,

analyzed: āgacchantī sakam ghara  vihāram daṭṭhum pāvisi
translated: as I was returning to my home,🔽I entered a monastery
in the Añjana Grove in Sāketa.
Seeing the Light of the World,
I paid homage and sat down.
Out of compassion, he taught me the Dhamma,
the one with vision.
Having heard the great one’s teaching,
I penetrated the truth.
Right there, in the dust-free Dhamma,
I touched the deathless state.
Then, having understood the true Dhamma,
I went forth into homelessness.
Having attained the three knowledges,
the Buddha’s instruction is not in vain.”
… the elder nun Sujātā …
